title.text: OSU-GP: Attribute Selection using Genetic Programming

abstractContent.text: This system's approach to the attribute selection task was to use a genetic programming algorithm to search fora solution to the task.
The evolved programs for the furniture and people domain exhibit quite naive behavior, and the DICE and MASI scores on the training sets reflect the poor humanlikeness of the programs.

tableCaptions.text: Table 2: The costs GP should minimize

Table 2. The costs were de- vised with an eye towards optimizing quantities that  existing algorithms for this task also attempt to opti- mize.  DICE and MASI scores on the training data were  converted to costs by subtracting from one. The  noHit cost is for not forming a distinguishing col- lection of attributes and was given a high weight.  The bloat penalty penalizes long programs (to make  interpreting the result easier).
